data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In all the previous steps you are facing one way, the opposite direction from where you started. Once you are facing backward, make sure you start your new steps from place A (on facing forward), place B (facing upward), place C (facing downward), and place D (facing upward). In the last step, make sure you continue taking forward steps, do not make backward steps. So, the answer is yes.

This is an out-of-order procedure based on counting forwards and backwards. If you are taking six steps forward, then you immediately move forward 7 steps. If you are taking 4 steps forward, then you immediately move backward 4 steps. If you are taking 9 steps backward, then you immediately move to the starting point 27 steps back. All in all, following these steps takes you back to the starting point 2 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.
